item.title: Basics of C++
item.description: The Theory of C++ Basics of C++ Variables: In programming, a variable is a container (storage area) to hold data. They can-not be keywords. Literals: Literals are data used for representing fixed values like integer, character, strings and floating numbers. Constants: Their values cannot change. Certain variables defined using consts or #define can also act as constants. Basic Input/Output cout The cout object in C++ is an object of class ostream.
